update.description:
This pull request has two goals:

* Allow a positive and negative multi-step while playing back a log file.
* Change the semantics of a multi-step. Now, when we set the `step_size` to 100, and then we step, what we observe is 100 individual steps. The new behavior is to observe in the client side only one step of `step_size` 100.

It will be connected with the GUI in a future pull request. Probably @chapulina will make the magic.

A few comments:

*  I created a new message `LogPlaybackControl` to control the playback. The message contains functionality for pause/play the log, step, rewind, forward or seek. This pull request tackles pause/play and step. The next pull request will implement the rest of the features.
* Stepping forward with big `step_size` or stepping backwards when you're far from the beginning of the log file is really slow.

When we have all the functionality working and connected with the GUI I'll probably make another pull request for using keyframes in the log file that will speedup the playback.

**Update**: While reviewing this pull request, we found that it would be nice to include in the log file the simulation `iterations`. If `<iterations>` is present in the log file, we should use it during playback and the world should replace its `iterations` value with the one saved in the log file. Two separate pull requests have been created to tackle this feature: 

   * https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/188
   * #!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1722
update.title: Implement forward/backwards multi-step for log playback

content.raw: A part from this, the whole thing seems to work fine for me. I can send steps forwards/backwards and the behaviour is the expected. I was unable to make it fail. On big multisteps (-1000) it takes some seconds to update the simulation, something probably to handle at GUI level.

content.raw: I've create a unit test for `LogPlay::Rewind()`in 6ba9265 and d4048b1. We can do an integration test in a different pull request because it requires more work. AFAIK we cannot load a world using `ServerFixture::Load()` based on a log file. First, we have to add this feature, and then, create the integration test and use the message interface to do multi-step.
content.html: I've create a unit test for LogPlay::Rewind()in 6ba9265 and d4048b1. We can do an integration test in a different pull request because it requires more work. AFAIK we cannot load a world using ServerFixture::Load() based on a log file. First, we have to add this feature, and then, create the integration test and use the message interface to do multi-step.

* Allow a positive and negative multi-step while playing back a log file.
* Change the semantics of a multi-step. Now, when we set the `step_size` to 100, and then we step, what we observe is 100 individual steps. The new behavior is to observe in the client side only one step of `step_size` 100.

content.html:
You can create a LogPlaybackControl message, set the multi_step value and publish the message to the ~/playback_control topic. Alternatively you could replace MainWindow.cc::Step() with this snippet:

void MainWindow::Step()
{
  msgs::LogPlaybackControl msg;

  int steps;
  std::cout << "Number of steps: ";
  std::cin >> steps;
  std::cout << std::endl;
  std::cout << "\t(sending " << steps << " steps)" << std::endl;

  msg.set_multi_step(steps);

  this->logPlaybackPub->Publish(msg);
}

Assuming that you advertised the topic before with this->logPlaybackPub = this->node->Advertise<msgs::LogPlaybackControl>("~/playback_control");.

pull_request.title: Implement forward/backwards multi-step for log playback

update.description:
This pull request has two goals:

* Allow a positive and negative multi-step while playing back a log file.
* Change the semantics of a multi-step. Now, when we set the `step_size` to 100, and then we step, what we observe is 100 individual steps. The new behavior is to observe in the client side only one step of `step_size` 100.

It will be connected with the GUI in a future pull request. Probably @chapulina will make the magic.

A few comments:

*  I created a new message `LogPlaybackControl` to control the playback. The message contains functionality for pause/play the log, step, rewind, forward or seek. This pull request tackles pause/play and step. The next pull request will implement the rest of the features.
* Stepping forward with big `step_size` or stepping backwards when you're far from the beginning of the log file is really slow.

When we have all the functionality working and connected with the GUI I'll probably make another pull request for using keyframes in the log file that will speedup the playback.
update.title: Implement forward/backwards multi-step for log playback
